Regulation Title: Regulation 22e4 Liquidity Risk Management Programs
Description: Requires mutual funds and ETFs to implement liquidity risk management programs to protect investors.
Impact: Reduced risk of investor harm due to illiquidity.

Regulation Title: Regulation CF Crowdfunding
Description: Allows private companies to raise up to $1 million per year through crowdfunding from both accredited and nonaccredited investors.
Impact: Democratized investment in startups and small businesses.

Regulation Title: FAST Act Fixing America’s Surface Transportation Act – Securities Disclosure Provisions
Description: Included provisions to simplify and modernize SEC disclosure requirements for public companies.
Impact: Reduced regulatory burden and streamlined reporting for issuers.

Regulation Title: Regulation A+ Expanded Small Public Offerings
Description: Allows companies to offer and sell up to $50 million of securities in a 12month period with streamlined reporting.
Impact: Greater access to capital for small and midsized companies.

Regulation Title: Regulation AT Automated Trading Proposal
Description: Proposed a framework for risk controls and registration for firms engaged in automated trading on U.S. futures markets.
Impact: Enhanced market integrity and risk management in automated trading.

Regulation Title: Regulation Systems Compliance and Integrity Regulation SCI
Description: Requires key market participants to have policies and procedures for technology systems that support the U.S. securities markets.
Impact: Increased operational resilience and market stability.

Regulation Title: Regulation MM Money Market Fund Reform
Description: Established new rules for money market funds, including floating NAVs and liquidity fees to reduce run risk.
Impact: Improved stability and transparency in money market funds.

Regulation Title: Regulation D Rule 506c General Solicitation for Private Offerings
Description: Permits general solicitation in private offerings, provided all purchasers are accredited investors and verification procedures are followed.
Impact: Expanded methods for raising private capital.

Regulation Title: Regulation S Exemption for Offshore Offerings
Description: Provides a safe harbor for offers and sales of securities outside the United States, exempting them from SEC registration.
Impact: Facilitated global capital raising by U.S. and foreign issuers.

Regulation Title: Regulation D Rule 504 Increased Offering Limit
Description: Increased the maximum offering amount under Rule 504 to $5 million in a 12month period for certain private offerings.
Impact: Provided greater capitalraising opportunities for small businesses.

Regulation Title: Jumpstart Our Business Startups JOBS Act
Description: Eased securities regulations to encourage funding of small businesses and startups. Allowed crowdfunding, increased Reg A+ limits, and eased IPO requirements for emerging growth companies.
Impact: Lowered barriers for startups to access capital; increased investor opportunities.

Regulation Title: Whistleblower Program DoddFrank Act
Description: Created a program that rewards individuals who provide information about securities law violations.
Impact: Increased detection and enforcement of securities violations.

Regulation Title: Office of Minority and Women Inclusion Establishment
Description: Created to ensure diversity and inclusion in management, employment, and business activities of the SEC and regulated entities.
Impact: Promoted diversity and inclusion in the securities industry.

Regulation Title: Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board MSRB Expanded Authority
Description: Expanded the MSRB’s authority to regulate municipal advisors, not just brokerdealers and banks, as part of DoddFrank.
Impact: Improved regulation and oversight in the municipal securities market.

Regulation Title: Office of the Investor Advocate Establishment
Description: Established an office within the SEC to assist retail investors and ensure their interests are considered in regulatory actions.
Impact: Enhanced investor advocacy and protection.

Regulation Title: Office of Municipal Securities Establishment
Description: Created an office within the SEC to coordinate the regulation and oversight of municipal securities markets.
Impact: Improved transparency and regulatory focus on municipal securities.

Regulation Title: DoddFrank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
Description: Comprehensive reform of U.S. financial regulation in response to the 2008 crisis. Created new agencies, increased oversight, introduced "Volcker Rule", and enhanced consumer protection.
Impact: Major changes to financial regulation; increased compliance requirements.

Regulation Title: Volcker Rule as part of DoddFrank Act
Regulatory Body: Federal Reserve, SEC, FDIC, OCC, CFTC
Description: Prohibits banks from proprietary trading and limits their ownership in hedge funds and private equity funds.
Impact: Reduced risktaking by banks, increased market stability.

Regulation Title: Office of Credit Ratings Establishment
Description: Created the Office of Credit Ratings within the SEC to oversee and examine nationally recognized statistical rating organizations NRSROs.
Impact: Improved regulatory oversight and accountability for credit rating agencies.

Regulation Title: Regulation RR Credit Risk Retention Rule
Regulatory Body: SEC, Federal Reserve, OCC, FDIC, FHFA, HUD
Description: Requires securitizers of assetbacked securities to retain a portion of the credit risk, aligning interests with investors.
Impact: Reduced moral hazard and improved assetbacked securities market integrity.

Regulation Title: Regulation R
Description: Defined the scope of securities activities banks may conduct without registering as brokerdealers.
Impact: Clarified regulatory boundaries between banking and securities activities.

Regulation Title: Regulation E Exemptions for Securities of Small Business Investment Companies
Description: Provides exemptions from registration for securities issued by certain small business investment companies.
Impact: Facilitates capital formation for small business investment companies.

Regulation Title: Credit Rating Agency Reform Act
Description: Established a registration and oversight regime for credit rating agencies to improve ratings quality and transparency.
Impact: Increased oversight of credit rating agencies; improved reliability of ratings.

Regulation Title: Regulation E Securities Offerings of Certain Investment Companies
Description: Provides exemptions for offerings of securities by certain small business investment companies, facilitating their fundraising.
Impact: Improved access to capital for small investment companies.

Regulation Title: Regulation AB AssetBacked Securities Disclosure
Description: Sets disclosure and reporting requirements for public offerings of assetbacked securities.
Impact: Increased transparency and investor confidence in ABS markets.

Regulation Title: Regulation NMS Order Protection Rule
Description: Established rules to ensure investors receive the best price executions for their orders and to foster competition among markets.
Impact: Improved execution quality and market efficiency.

Regulation Title: Regulation MA Mergers and Acquisitions Disclosure
Description: Establishes disclosure and procedural requirements for business combinations and tender offers.
Impact: Improved transparency and investor protection in M&A transactions.

Regulation Title: Regulation M AntiManipulation Rules Concerning Securities Offerings
Description: Prohibits activities that could artificially influence the market for securities being offered, including manipulative practices during offerings.
Impact: Increased market integrity and investor confidence in offerings.

Regulation Title: Regulation SHO Short Sales
Description: Establishes requirements for short sales, including locate and closeout requirements to address “naked” short selling.
Impact: Reduced market manipulation and improved market integrity.

Regulation Title: Regulation AC Analyst Certification
Description: Requires research analysts to certify the views expressed in research reports and public appearances, and disclose conflicts of interest.
Impact: Improved integrity and reliability of analyst research.

Regulation Title: Regulation BTR Blackout Trading Restriction
Description: Prohibits directors and executive officers of public companies from trading equity securities during pension fund blackout periods.
Impact: Increased fairness and transparency in trading by insiders.

Regulation Title: SarbanesOxley Act SOX
Description: Created new standards for public company boards, management, and public accounting firms. Established PCAOB, enhanced financial disclosures, and imposed criminal penalties for misconduct.
Impact: Improved corporate governance; increased compliance costs.
